response.answer_text: In short term yes, because cocaine is a dopamine reuptake inhibitor, but chronical abuse makes everything worse. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2774931/ The half life of cocaine is very short ~60 minutes, it does not last long enough to improve the depression properly. And it is a illegal drug one can get serious troubles including prison and this is a very depressing thing. Chewing coca leaves could probably help (it is my personal opinion), but it is also forbidden, except in the Netherlands, Czech Republic or some South-American countries. No, it can actually make you worse. When you take cocaine your brain will produce so much dopamine and when you stop taking it, your dopamine levels will never go up that high. So in the end you will feel like you can never be happy again unless you have another dose of cocaine. By the way, cocaine can cause psychosis.
